summary: This document is a detailed index of discovery materials produced by the prosecution to the defense in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). It lists hundreds of items including police reports, FBI interview summaries (302s), deposition transcripts, emails, notes, articles, and other evidence, organized by Bates number ranges (3502-3531). The index covers materials from 1995 to 2021, indicating the extensive scope of evidence collected.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell

keyFacts: The document is a comprehensive index of discovery produced to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, listing over 500 individual items.
The evidence spans from 1995 to 2021 and includes police reports, FBI interviews (302s), grand jury transcripts, depositions, emails, text messages, flight logs, and media articles.
Multiple grand jury proceedings are documented, including key dates on 2020-06-28 and 2021-03-29.
The index references numerous Palm Beach Police Department reports from the mid-2000s, which are foundational to the early investigations into Jeffrey Epstein and associates.
The document is subject to a protective order restricting the disclosure of certain information (paragraphs 7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17).
